intro: Hebestigma cubense, commonly known as the Cuban hebestigma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Hebestigma cubense typically thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
